result.execSummary:
The defendant William Earl Brooks Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $50.00 payable to Patty K. within six months of release.

AS TO COUNTS ONE AND THREE:  Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA by the end of supervision.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS ORDERED:  to be paid through collection  by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after one year of confinement.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to count three.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol or drug.
No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.

Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
All applicable fees of supervision by the end of supervision.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department. Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent to count one.

records.addlTxt: Transcript commencing September 30, 2014, Sentencing (25 pages).vmb
See case no. 14CF001588 for request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 9/29/14 for Amanda G. and Melissa L. for 1 appearance each on 9/29/14.

Defendant William Earl Brooks in court with attorney Joshua D. Uller.  Defendant William Earl Brooks in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4 YEARS with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence, but CONCURRENT to Count 3; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6 YEARS with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence, but CONCURRENT to Count 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program, but IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program after one year of confinement.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $50.00 payable to Patty K within 6 months of release; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA by the end of supervision); 
All applicable fees of supervision by the end of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter   
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Victim Impact Statement received and filed.

Pursuant to plea negotiations, Count 2 is dismissed but read in for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Counts 1 & 3:

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.

Defendant William Earl Brooks in court with attorney Joshua D. Uller.  Defendant William Earl Brooks in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Amended Information received and filed.  On motion of the State, Court ordered case amended to:
Count 10 amended to Count 1- Unauthorized Use of Personal Identifying Information or Documents (Obtain Thing of Value) Party to a Crime, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 943.201(2)(a), 939.50(3)(h) and 939.05, a Class H Felony.
Count 12 amended to Count 2- Unauthorized Use of Personal Identifying Information or Documents (Obtain Thing of Value) Party to a Crime, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 943.201(2)(a), 939.50(3)(h) and 939.05, a Class H Felony.
Counts 14 & 15 amended to Count 3- Unauthorized Use of Personal Identifying Information or Documents (Obtain Thing of Value) Party to a Crime, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 943.201(2)(a), 939.50(3)(h) and 939.05, a Class H Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
